title: Assistantship
description: Supported the professor into assessing and improving the course for its next occurrence.

title: Assistantship
description: Created a first draft for a Scala mini-project for the course on web applications. Helped students with the course’s exercises and mini projects.

title: Changemakers Program
description: Completed the EPFL Future Leader’s Changemakers program on transforming ideas into real-life projects and developing entrepreneurial skills.

title: Assistantship
description: Helped students with the course’s exercises and project about database systems.

title: Assistantship
description: Helped students with the course’s robotics projects. Contributed to a course manual on chapters about laser cutting, 3D printing and stepper motors.

title: Social Science Project
description: Using the Unity framework, contributed to building a 3D game, in collaboration with the Montreux Jazz Festival's archives. Presented this game at the EPFL Open Days

title: Bachelor Project
description: Creation of an open-source, 7 degrees-of-freedom wooden laser-cut robotic arm that aims to be easily reproducible. Creation of the software to control and animate it.

title: Part-Time Software Developer
description: Enhancement of the VR Project started during the internship aimed at developing a solution to teach logistics to students.

title: Software Development Internship
description: Development of a Solution to teach logistics to students, Virtual Reality Project using SCRUM methodology. As part of the project’s team, brought additional features and ideas, developed in C# using the Unity software.

title: Assistantship
description: Helped students for the Theory of Computation course’s exercise session. Teaching, active listening, demonstrated openness to consider alternative solutions. Awarded IC Teaching Assistant Award 2022 for contribution to teaching excellence.

title: Software Development Internship
description: Used Spring for Java (Server building framework) and Angular for JavaScript (Website front-end framework) to create a demo version of a project-scheduler application.
